title: Magnetic flux - changing area changing flux

content.question: Two square loops of wire, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, are placed in a uniform magnetic field as shown in the figure. Loop <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> has sides of length <math alttext="L sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and Loop <math alttext="B " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> has sides of length <math alttext="2 L sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following is equal to the ratio of the flux <math alttext="phi sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></mstyle></math> through Loop <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> to the flux <math alttext="phi sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></mstyle></math> through Loop <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="phi sub B to phi sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></mstyle></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
